014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject;
015
016import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
017import org.jdbi.v3.core.HandleCallback;
018import org.jdbi.v3.core.HandleConsumer;
019
020/**
021 * SqlObject base interface.  All synthesized implementations implement
022 * this interface, even if the declaration doesn't extend {@code SqlObject}.
023 *
024 * Custom mixins may be written as subinterfaces of this class with default methods.
025 */
026public interface SqlObject {
027    /**
028     * Returns the handle used in the current sql object context.
029     *
030     * @return the handle used in the current sql object context.
031     */
032    Handle getHandle();
033
034    /**
035     * A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of the handle associated to this sql object,
036     * and yields it to a callback for use by clients.
037     *
038     * @param callback A callback which will receive the handle associated to this sql object
039     * @param <R> type returned by the callback
040     * @param <X> exception type thrown by the callback, if any.
041     *
042     * @return the value returned by callback
043     *
044     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback
045     */
046    <R, X extends Exception> R withHandle(HandleCallback<R, X> callback) throws X;
047
048    /**
049     * A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of the handle associated to this sql object,
050     * and yields it to a consumer for use by clients.
051     *
052     * @param consumer A consumer which will receive the handle associated to this sql object
053     * @param <X> exception type thrown by the callback, if any.
054     *
055     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback
056     */
057    default <X extends Exception> void useHandle(HandleConsumer<X> consumer) throws X {
058        withHandle(consumer.asCallback());
059    }
060}
